poem:
### Tariff Morning

Tick of the clock, minute past midnight,  
iron-clad promises waking to tariffs—  
newsprint inked with hostile numbers.  
Cargo ships on stilts, treading fearful  
across this sea of tariffs and tensions.  
Nation whispers to nation, in markets  
where calculations dream of zero-sum  
but wake to subtraction, fractions of fear.
